intro: Simsia abrotanoides, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its bright orange to red ray flowers attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. The leaves are usually alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs.
